metadata.title: CVE-2018-17233 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A SIGFPE signal is raised in the functionH5D__create_chunk_file_map_hyper() of H5Dchunk.c in the HDF HDF5 through1.10.3 library during an attempted parse of a crafted HDF file, because ofincorrect protection against division by zero. It could allow a remotedenial of service attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
hdf5-tools - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
libhdf5-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
libhdf5-cpp-11 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
libhdf5-mpich-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
libhdf5-openmpi-10 - 1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.16+docs-4ubuntu1.1+esm2').
